Contributor: Wilson, David, artist.; British Empire Union, publisher.; Globe Printing Co., printer.;
Note: Signed "David Wilson" + "WFB." Date based on dates of 1st World War. Orientation: Vertical.
Description: Text says to remember that Germans are not to be trusted. Once a German, always a German! Every German employed means that a British worker would be idle. Illustrations show five different depictions of German men being barbarian in the war. One depiction shows a German man dressed in a suit, tipping his hat to be polite, with the words "1914-1918, Never again!"
Digital Collection: Allied Posters of World War I
Local Rights Statement: This material is made available for private study, scholarship, and research use. For access to the original or a high resolution reproduction, contact: Temple University Libraries, Special Collections Research Center, scrc@temple.edu, 215-204-8257.
